paragraphs: Various ropes are spun by the mountain,
Caesar's genius turns the work with a thunderbolt.
Cities flourish under these, great walls rise,
But they collapse, convulsed by your Lagallan art.
Pelion rises, and bones are placed on the icy,
Caves echo with men, the mobile wave rages.
Countless orbs were born from threatening attempts,
(I sing with the moon as witness, which brought new destinies)
But Caesar scatters the dark dreams with light,
And teaches trembling minds to play with illusions.
Away fly the fleeting images of the World,
To shape them is not our task, but to give laws to the Sky.
